workflowInfo.workflowDescription: This is the SMP/E installation of Zowe

variable.name: jobCard
variable.label: jobCard
variable.abstract: Change jobCard to 'YES' to generate a job card for the JCL,if you have a default job card you ..
variable.description:
Change jobCard to 'YES' to generate a job card for the JCL,
if you have a default job card you want to use do not change this value.

variable.name: acct
variable.label: acct
variable.abstract: Change acct to a valid accounting information parameter.This value is required and only used i..
variable.description:
Change acct to a valid accounting information parameter.
This value is required and only used if a new jobcard is generated.
(see jobCard)

variable.name: user
variable.label: user
variable.abstract: Change user to a valid user ID on the system to identify the person submitting the job.This va..
variable.description:
Change user to a valid user ID on the system to identify the person submitting the job.
This value only used if a new jobcard is generated and it is not required.

variable.name: sysaff
variable.label: sysaff
variable.abstract: Change sysaff to indicate the JES2 members and JES3 systems that are eligible to process the job.<..
variable.description:
Change sysaff to indicate the JES2 members and JES3 systems that are eligible to process the job.
This value only used if a new jobcard is generated and it is not required.

variable.name: csivol
variable.label: CSI Volume Serial
variable.abstract: Change csivol to the volser for the CSI and SMP/E data sets, if you choose not to use the defau..
variable.description:
Change csivol to the volser for the CSI and SMP/E data sets,
if you choose not to use the default of letting your Automatic
Class Selection (ACS) routines decide which volume to use.

variable.name: storclass
variable.label: Storage Class
variable.abstract: If required, change storclass for the SMS-managed CSI and SMP/E data sets.
variable.description:
If required, change storclass for the SMS-managed CSI and SMP/E data sets.
SMS uses the attributes in the storage class
for the storage service level of the data set.
Note that installation-written ACS routines may select
a management class and data class and can
override the specified storage class.

variable.name: dataclass
variable.label: Data Class
variable.abstract: If required, change dataclass for SMS-managed CSI and SMP/E data sets. Use the DATACLAS parameter..
variable.description:
If required, change dataclass for
SMS-managed CSI and SMP/E data sets.
Use the DATACLAS parameter to specify a data class
for a new data set. The storage administrator at your
installation defines the names of the data classes
you can code on the DATACLAS parameter.

variable.name: mgmtclass
variable.label: Management Class
variable.abstract: You can change management class for SMS-managed CSI and SMP/E data sets. Use the MGMTCLAS par..
variable.description:
You can change management class for
SMS-managed CSI and SMP/E data sets.
Use the MGMTCLAS parameter to specify a management class
for a new SMS-managed data set.

variable.name: tzone
variable.label: Target Library Zone
variable.abstract: Change tzone to your CSI target zone name...
variable.description: Change tzone to your CSI target zone name.

variable.name: csihlq
variable.label: CSI High Level Qualifier
variable.abstract: Change csihlq to the high level qualifier for the CSI and other SMP/E data sets. The maximum le..
variable.description:
Change csihlq to the high level qualifier for the CSI and
other SMP/E data sets. The maximum length is 35 characters.

variable.name: dzone
variable.label: Distribution Library Zone
variable.abstract: Change dzone to your CSI distribution zone name...
variable.description: Change dzone to your CSI distribution zone name.

variable.name: hlq
variable.label: SMPMCS High Level Qualifier
variable.abstract: Change ${hlq} to the high level qualifier(s) of the SMPMCS andREL files, as specified when upl..
variable.description:
Change ${hlq} to the high level qualifier(s) of the SMPMCS and
REL files, as specified when uploading the files to the host
(as described in the program directory).

variable.name: thlq
variable.label: Target Library High Level Qualifier
variable.abstract: Change thlq to the appropriate high level qualifier(s) for the target data sets. The maximum le..
variable.description:
Change thlq to the appropriate high level qualifier(s) for
the target data sets. The maximum length is 35 characters.

variable.name: tvol
variable.label: Target Library Volume
variable.abstract: By default, this job relies on your Automatic Class Selection(ACS) routines to place the targe..
variable.description:
By default, this job relies on your Automatic Class Selection
(ACS) routines to place the target data sets. You can
place the data sets on a specific volume when you:
Change tvol to the volser for the target libraries.
if you have SMS-management, keep this with default #tvol
and set storage class (optionally management and data class)

variable.name: tsclass
variable.label: Target Library Storage Class
variable.abstract: Change storclass for the SMS-managed target data sets. SMS uses the attributes in the storage cla..
variable.description:
Change storclass for the SMS-managed target data sets.
SMS uses the attributes in the storage class
for the storage service level of the data set.
Note that installation-written ACS routines may select
a management class and data class and can
override the specified storage class.

variable.name: tdclass
variable.label: Target Library Data Class
variable.abstract: You can change dataclass for SMS-managed target data sets. Use the DATACLAS parameter to spe..
variable.description:
You can change dataclass for
SMS-managed target data sets.
Use the DATACLAS parameter to specify a data class
for a new data set. The storage administrator at your
installation defines the names of the data classes
you can code on the DATACLAS parameter.

variable.name: tmclass
variable.label: Target Library Management Class
variable.abstract: You can change management class for SMS-managed target data sets. Use the MGMTCLAS parameter ..
variable.description:
You can change management class for
SMS-managed target data sets.
Use the MGMTCLAS parameter to specify a management class
for a new SMS-managed data set.

variable.name: dvol
variable.label: Distribution Library Volume Serial
variable.abstract: By default, this job relies on your Automatic Class Selection(ACS) routines to place the distr..
variable.description:
By default, this job relies on your Automatic Class Selection
(ACS) routines to place the distribution data sets. You can
place the data sets on a specific volume when you:
Change dvol to the volser for the target libraries.
if you have SMS-management, keep this with default #dvol
and set storage class (optionally management and data class)

variable.name: dsclass
variable.label: Distribution Library Storage Class
variable.abstract: Change storclass for the SMS-managed distribution data sets. SMS uses the attributes in the stora..
variable.description:
Change storclass for the SMS-managed distribution data sets.
SMS uses the attributes in the storage class
for the storage service level of the data set.
Note that installation-written ACS routines may select
a management class and data class and can
override the specified storage class.

variable.name: ddclass
variable.label: Distribution Library Data Class
variable.abstract: You can change dataclass for the SMS-managed distribution data sets. Use the DATACLAS parameter ..
variable.description:
You can change dataclass for
SMS-managed distribution data sets.
Use the DATACLAS parameter to specify a data class
for a new data set. The storage administrator at your
installation defines the names of the data classes
you can code on the DATACLAS parameter.

variable.name: dmclass
variable.label: Distribution Library Management Class
variable.abstract: You can change management class for the SMS-managed distribution data sets. Use the MGMTCLAS para..
variable.description:
You can change management class for
SMS-managed distribution data sets.
Use the MGMTCLAS parameter to specify a management class
for a new SMS-managed data set.

variable.name: dhlq
variable.label: Distribution Library High Level Qualifier
variable.abstract: Change dhlq to the appropriate high level qualifier(s) for the distribution data sets. The maxim..
variable.description:
Change dhlq to the appropriate high level qualifier(s) for
the distribution data sets. The maximum length is 35 characters.

variable.name: fsdsn
variable.label: File System Data Set Name
variable.abstract: Change the string fsdsn to the appropriate data set name for the file system that will be creat..
variable.description:
Change the string fsdsn to the appropriate data set name
for the file system that will be created.

variable.name: pathPrefix
variable.label: Path Prefix
variable.abstract: Change the string "-PathPrefix-" to the appropriate high level directory name with leading and ..
variable.description:
Change the string "-PathPrefix-" to the appropriate
high level directory name with leading and trailing "/". For
users installing in the root this would be "/". For others,
the high level directory may be something like "/service/",
or a more meaningful name.
Please note that the replacement string is case sensitive.

variable.name: dsprefix
variable.label: Data Set Prefix
variable.abstract: If you are APPLYing this function for the first time, change dsprefix to the value specified fo..
variable.description:
If you are APPLYing this function for the first time, change
dsprefix to the value specified for DSPREFIX in the OPTIONS
entry of the GLOBAL zone.
If you used the optional ZWE1SMPE job to define the CSI,
the dsprefix value will match the CSI high level qualifier.

Otherwise keep this with default and set thlq and tvol (or tsclass)

variable.name: fsvol
variable.label: File System Volume
variable.abstract: Change fsvol to the volser for the file system, if you choose not to use the default of letting..
variable.description:
Change fsvol to the volser for the file system,
if you choose not to use the default of letting your Automatic
Class Selection (ACS) routines decide which volume to use.
if you have SMS-management, keep this with default #fsvol
and set storage class (possibli management and data class)

variable.name: fsclass
variable.label: File System Storage Class
variable.abstract: Change storclass for the SMS-managed file system data sets. SMS uses the attributes in the storag..
variable.description:
Change storclass for the SMS-managed file system data sets.
SMS uses the attributes in the storage class
for the storage service level of the data set.
Note that installation-written ACS routines may select
a management class and data class and can
override the specified storage class.

variable.name: fdclass
variable.label: File System Data Class
variable.abstract: You can change dataclass for the SMS-managed file system data sets. Use the DATACLAS parameter t..
variable.description:
You can change dataclass for
SMS-managed file system data sets.
Use the DATACLAS parameter to specify a data class
for a new data set. The storage administrator at your
installation defines the names of the data classes
you can code on the DATACLAS parameter.

variable.name: fmclass
variable.label: File System Management Class
variable.abstract: You can change management class for SMS-managed file system data sets. Use the MGMTCLAS param..
variable.description:
You can change management class for
SMS-managed file system data sets.
Use the MGMTCLAS parameter to specify a management class
for a new SMS-managed data set.

step.name: define_variables
step.title: Define Variables
step.instructions: Run this step to initialize variable values

step.name: ZWE1SMPE
step.title: CSI Allocation
step.description: Allocates a CSI and data sets required by SMP/E
step.instructions: Allocates a CSI and data sets required by SMP/E

step.name: ZWE3ALOC
step.title: Target and Distribution Allocation
step.description: Allocates target and distribution libraries for SMP/E
step.instructions: Allocates target and distribution libraries for SMP/E

step.name: ZWE4ZFS
step.title: File System Allocation
step.description: Allocates and mounts the USS File System for ZOWE
step.instructions: Allocates and mounts the USS File System for ZOWE

step.name: ZWE5MKD
step.title: File Structure
step.description: Creates the file/folder structure in the allocated mount point
step.instructions: Creates the file/folder structure in the allocated mount point

step.name: ZWE6DDEF
step.title: DDEF Creation
step.description: This step creates the DDEF entries
step.instructions: This step creates the DDEF entries
